ETYMOLOGY: From French fertiliser, from fertile, from Latin fertilis ('fruitful, fertile'), from ferre ('to bear, carry').

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: transitive verb: a verb that takes one or more objects
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: To add nutrients to soil or land to make it more productive for growing plants.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 向土壤或土地施加养分，以提高其植物生长能力或产量。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: Farmers fertilize their fields every spring to ensure a good harvest.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 农民每年春天给田地施肥以确保丰收。

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: transitive verb: a verb that takes one or more objects
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: To cause an egg or ovum to develop into a new individual by introducing male gametes (sperm).
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 使卵子或卵细胞与雄性配子（精子）结合，从而使其发育成为新的个体。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: Only one sperm is needed to fertilize an egg.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 只需要一个精子就能使卵子受精。
